comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content:
This photo, dated ca.1940, was taken at nearly the same time as the one above, which is dated 193-. Both photos were taken in the same room (notice the books, stacked similarly on the mantelpiece):
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/4931778169/in/photostream/]

comment.author: 76016463@N00
comment._content: Ahmet and Nesuhi Ertegun (most remembered from ther association with Atlantic Records) were the sons of a high-ranking Turkish diplomat, Münir Ertegün, who was Turkish Ambassador to the U.S. from 1934 until his death in 1944. This probably accounts for the location in the Turkish Embassy. Herb Abramson, who founded Atlantic Records with Ahmet, is also in this photo. en.wikipedia.org/wiki/M%C3%BCnir_Erteg%C3%BCn
